recipe.title: Pok Pok-Style Hot Wings with Peanuts and Cilantro
ingredients: 2 pounds chicken wings, tips removed, drumettes and flats separated, patted dry
1–2 jalapeño or serrano chiles, stemmed, seeded, finely chopped
instructions: Preheat oven to 500°F. Set a wire rack inside a large rimmed baking sheet. Toss wings, oil, and salt in a large bowl. Arrange wings in a single layer on rack and bake until golden brown, crispy, and cooked through, about 30 minutes.

Make the glaze: Heat a small saucepan over medium. Sprinkle a thin layer of sugar into pan, let melt, then add another layer (no stirring necessary). Repeat until all sugar is melted and turns into a syrup. Cook the syrup undisturbed until it becomes deep amber in color and smells nutty, 2–3 minutes. Remove from heat and slowly whisk in garlic and fish sauce (it might splatter); stir until smooth.
